attributes.comment:
As wait times for China adoptions are predicted to lengthen to at least 2 years, if
not 2.5 years, after submisison of initial I-600A, most families in the adoption
process will need to refile their I-600A at least one time if not twice. This adds a
huge financial burden to families who are already financially stretched thin by the
whole cost of adoption. The proposal to raise current I-600A related cost for
Biometrics and filing the form by nearly $150 per couple is worrisome. Again, with
the current predicted wait times, most families will need to refile once. Some
families may need to refile twice. Per filing, that calculates out to $685 at the
current fees and to $830 with the proposed fee hike. This is in addition to the
$685 that was already submitted with the original filing. If a family needs to refile
twice, at the proposed fee schedule, that would be another $1660 for a total of
$2345 in filing fees for just the I-600A form alone. This is an enormous amount of
money for families to be burdened with. For the sake of the children in need of
forever families and for the sake of the families who so desparately want to bring
their children home, please reconsider and do NOT implement the fee increase
proposal.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Mai Phung
